item.title: Turtle Entertainment allegedly sold
item.description:
A report from today by German news outlet Golem.de says that Turtle Entertainment, the company that operates the premier esports brand ESL, might have been sold.

Click here to read the full article.
item.author: info@gosugamers.net (Radoslav "Nydra" Kolev)
item.dc:creator: Radoslav "Nydra" Kolev
item.content:encoded:

item.title: GosuGamers now supports Douyu TV streams
item.description:
Today, GosuGamers takes another step towards a truly global eSports experience. Through the cooperation with our friends at Douyu TV, our readers will now be able to watch their favorite Chinese teams and personalities right from our pages.

Click here to read the full article.

item.title: Google-Twitch deal reportedly finalized?
item.description:
Google's deal to buy Twitch has reportedly been finalized as the internet giant gets ready to acquire the popular livestreaming platform under its wings for a whopping $1 billion.

Click here to read the full article.
item.author: info@gosugamers.net (Karan "Mantis-" Jain)

item.title: Newly-launched WECG aims to resurrect the spirit of eSports olympics
item.description:
The official press release of World e-Sports Championship Games speaks of a project that is to pick up from where the World Cyber Games left off and continue the traditions of the multi-national, multi-discipline event.

Click here to read the full article.

item.title: Editorial: Clauf'd up
item.description:
Radoslav "Nydra" Kolev tells the story of ESGN - from the lavish feasts to the money famine - and explains why it was never going to work.

item.title: Top 4 must-watch e-Sports documentaries
item.description:
Following the release of Valve's highly anticipated film Free-To-Play, the community has seen a surge of interest in films related to Esports and so here is a list of the Top 4 e-Sports documentaries already released, that every player should watch.

Click here to read the full article.
